entry.title: Service bits for pruned nodes
entry.summary: On the Bitcoin-development mailing list, a discussion took place regarding the use of centralized methods like DNS for bootstrapping versus non-centralized peer discovery mechanisms. John Dillon suggested that DNS should only be used for simple initial bootstrapping and development efforts should focus on optimizing peer discovery mechanisms. He also encouraged others to develop better bootstrap mechanisms. The email ends with an advertisement for AppDynamics Lite, a free troubleshooting tool designed for production.
